results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: ARTV
results.brief_description:
The Australian Centre for the Moving Image and SBS Independent will commission 16 artists to produce works for ARTV, an exhibition program which will be broadcast on SBS and shown on screens throughout ACMI concurrently, commencing on 8 June 2004.

ARTV is part of 2004, a survey exhibition of contemporary Australian visual culture presented by the Australian Centre for the Moving Image and the National Gallery of Victoria.

results.title: I Look up, I look down
results.brief_description: A body falls gracefully through the air, kilometres from the earth, seeming to hover between falling, then rising again in a fluid dance that suspends and evades gravity. This looping video installation playfully dispels any laws of science as the casually dressed skydiver that we see floating through the air never gets closer to the ground. Moving hypnotically around the camera the body disorients all sense of up and down until at one point it seems to float, buffeted by the air, toward a passing plane.

results.title: Psycho samba
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: ‘Suddenly a bolt of electricity sprang forth from the screen and hit me in the head, scorching my forehead with uncanny resemblance of a burn that looked like a human eye. I could hear a buzzing in my ears, my newly formed third eye then began to secrete a special metallic-tasting liquid, as I saw visions of atomic bomb mushroom clouds.’ - Ian Haig (Chicago Underground Film Fest)
results.description: ‘Suddenly a bolt of electricity sprang forth from the screen and hit me in the head, scorching my forehead with uncanny resemblance of a burn that looked like a human eye. results.title: The Wolf
results.creator_credit: Beverly Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was Beverly Bailey’s husband who suggested she take the trip to England and Canada to meet his family. As Bailey disappeared through the airport door her husband wondered if he’d said the wrong thing.

results.title: A Little something about us
results.creator_credit: Sze Ching Lee and School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Interviews with several young women from diverse Asian backgrounds who, through pixellated images, share their aspirations, interests, and love-hate relationships with Mellbourne, the city that has adopted them.
